Name: Stela
Description: The left hand side of a wooden round-topped stela belonging to a scribe. In the upper part is one of a pair of sacred udjat-eyes, under which is the god Anubis lying upon a shrine, with a flagellum. Beneath this is the figure of a man standing before an offering table. The man wears a mid-length linen kilt with a robe over, and a short wig. Above him are four vertical columns of text, all that remains of the inscription. The low relief carving is of a very fine standard and traces of colour are still evident in the piece.
